metadata.name: GUI Input Capture - macOS
metadata.comment: Detects attempts to use system dialog prompts to capture user credentials

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND lower(process.name) = lower('/usr/sbin/osascript') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-e')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('display')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('dialog')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('answer')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('admin')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('administrator')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('authenticate')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('authentication')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('credentials')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('pass')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('password')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('unlock'))))

output.summary: Detects attempts to use system dialog prompts to capture user credentials

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate administration tools and activities References: https://github.com/redcanaryco/atomic-red-team/blob/f339e7da7d05f6057fdfcdd3742bfcf365fee2a9/atomics/T1056.002/T1056.002.md, https://scriptingosx.com/2018/08/user-interaction-from-bash-scripts/
